snippet: In the fall of 2010, Jonno Rattman was a college sophomore. When he started feeling overwhelmed by the troubles of the world, he began taking pictures of New York after dark and found “a deep cacophony of lust and fear.”
abstract: Photographer Jonno Rattman spent much of 2010 documenting strange, dark world unfolding outside of his apartment on Thompson Street in Greenwich Village during late night and early morning hours.
lead_paragraph: In the fall of 2010, Jonno Rattman was a college sophomore. When he started feeling overwhelmed by the troubles of the world, he began taking pictures of New York after dark and found “a deep cacophony of lust and fear.”
